notesStmt.note: First seven front flyleaves are modern paper, the eighth is parchment; first back flyleaf is parchment, last seven are modern paper
De Ricci, Seymour, with the assistance of W. J. Wilson, Census of Medieval and Renaissance Manuscripts in the United States and Canada, vol. 2 (New York: H. W. Wilson, 1935-40), p. 2035, no. 61.

Free Library of Philadelphia, A Descriptive Catalogue of the John Frederick Lewis Collection of European Manuscripts in the Free Library of Philadelphia, compiled by Edwin Wolf, 2nd, with an introduction by Dr. A.S.W. Rosenbach (Philadelphia: The Free Library, 1937), p. 99, no. 91.
Webber, Philip E., "Medieval Netherlandic Manuscripts in Greater Philadelphia Libraries," Archief- en bibliotheekwezen in België 47 (1976): pp. 482-484 (article pp. 459-513).

msIdentifier.collection: John Frederick Lewis Collection of European Manuscripts

msContents.summary: This manuscript is a late fifteenth-century Dutch book of hours for the Use of Utrecht with a calendar for the Use of Maastricht. Occasional corrections or additions are written in the lower margin with points of insertion marked in the text, possibly by the scribe. Two miniatures, a Pieta and a penitent David, are by a much later artist.

msItem.title: Book of Hours, Use of Utrecht
List of saints in sixteenth-century cursive hand, identical to beginning of list on fol. 70v in the Litany
Bernard of Clairvaux, Sermon beginning "O broeders. Ghetruwelick sal ic versuchtende ende eyschende ontfanghen ..."
Hours of the Virgin, translation of Geert Groote
Seven Penitential Psalms, translation of Geert Groote
Office of the Dead, translation of Geert Groote
Hours of Eternal Wisdom, translation of Geert Groote
Hours of the Holy Spirit, translation of Geert Groote
Hours of the Holy Cross, translation of Geert Groote
Prayer, "Ich sal mijn begeerten geuen den here voer alle sijn volck ..." (added by contemporary hand)
Prayers to be read before and after receiving the Holy Sacrament

supportDesc.extent: viii+164+viii; 142 x 100 mm bound to 150 x 115 mm
supportDesc.foliation: Modern foliation in pencil, upper right recto; added half folio between fols. 153 and 154, marked 153a

p.signatures: Possible trimmed signature b, fols. 25r-26r, lower right recto

layoutDesc.layout: One column of nineteen lines; frame-ruled in black ink; written area: 96 x 63 mm

scriptDesc.scriptNote: One scribe responsible for main text, another responsible for fols. 13r-13v, last collect on fol. 115r, fols. 132v-133v, and fol. 153a

decoDesc.decoNote: Two miniatures (Mater dolorosa, fol. 14v; David in penance, fol. 60v) added by post-medieval hand; large five-line flourished initials in red, blue, and purple ink at major text divisions; one- and two-line initials in alternating red and blue throughout
15rSix line red and blue initial H
142rFour line red and blue initial H

binding.p: Dark red morocco, gold-tooled in panel design, gold-tooled inner edges, marbled endleaves; HORAE / DUTCH MS. / XV. CENTURY stamped on gold-tooled spine with false raised bands; bound by H. Zucker of Philadelphia after 1912; in original wooden boards at Anderson sale in 1912

history.provenance: Lambertus and Conradus Eerens (sixteenth century); W.C. Crane; his sale New York, Anderson Auction Co., December 9, 1912, no. 386; John Frederick Lewis, Philadelphia; given by his widow, Anne Baker Lewis, to the Free Library of Philadelphia in 1936; Names of Lambertus Eerens and Conradus Eerens appears in sixteenth-century cursive hand on recto of original front flyleaf; name of Conradus Eerens appears twice again in lower margin of fol. 19r with date "1511" written in red ink; Same hand wrote list of saints on reverse of parchment flyleaf; Description of manuscript signed "Anderson Auction Co." and dated 10/12/1912, written in modern hand on original back flyleaf
